S.FORM: pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kadjamadjaman.
S.TRANSL: 我早上七點鐘到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: kitului anga, semaumaqan a sinsi, qivu a pancang a mayatucu, “gacalji! kicungali!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: pasiqacamen a qivu, “navenala sun sinsi.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: nu kitulutulu amen, tuluan amen ni sinsi tua supu na kinacalisiyanan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the paiwan language of numbers.

S.FORM: kitjavililj amen a kitulu tjai sinsi, saka men a semenasenay anga tua senay nua semupu.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: liyav anga ku kinacaqu a penaiwanan a kai.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many paiwan languages.

S.FORM: djemedje aken a sema gakku, djemedje aken a kitulu tua pinaiwanan, uri ku sipaladenga tjai kina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the paiwan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ti Ljumeg a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Ljumeg。
My name is Ljumeg.

S.FORM: ti Kuljelje a ngadan na ku kama.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Kuljelje。
My dad’s name is Kuljelje.

S.FORM: ti Sauniyaw a ngadan na ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Sauniyaw。
My mother’s name is Sauniyaw.

S.FORM: tapuluq anga a ku cavilj tucu.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: izua za ku kaka a uqaljay a tjavulung, ti Kapi a ngadan, tapuluq anga saka ita a cavilj nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Kapi，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Kapi, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: i tagakkuan amen a kitulutulu.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: tjengelay amen aravac a semenay.
S.TRANSL: 我們都很喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken a emave'av/ljemanguy, nu kaljapulavayan, vaik amen a emave'av/ljemanguy a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken a kipuqali(kipudrava), maqati amen a maciyuciyur a semenay a emave'av(ljemanguy).
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: aljak aken nua Paiwan zuku.
S.TRANSL: 我是排灣族的小孩。
I am an Paiwan child.

S.FORM: i Tjalja'avus a nia umaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在來義。
Our family lives in Tjalja’avus.

S.FORM: malje lima men a tace'eljan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: matjelu amen a marevetjevetjek.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: izua ti kama/ama, ti kina/ina tiaken, katua ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay katua tjavulung a vavayan, namatevetevelj amen a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 有爸爸、媽媽和我、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: qacaqaca ti kama, kisacu a ku kama.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: riljariljay ti kina, kuisang a ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: qivuyivu ti kama tua penaiyuanan i tjumaq tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the paiwan language with us at home.

S.FORM: nu kaljapulavayan cemikel amen a sema qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: vaik aken katua mareka ku kaka a tjavavulungan a djemekep tua kiav.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken aravac tua mareka ku sikatacemekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: vaik amen ati kina a kivangavang tucu a qadav.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: namaljenguaq a kalevelevan nu muqadadav, inika ljemaljaqel inika zemulezul, sarenguaq ca vali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: kemakan amen ta minpau i cemecemel i azatjan, ipaqadav amen, semeljec aravac.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: ta masukincengelj, mequdjilj a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: ku kivadaqan ti kina, akuazua mequdjilj cu a kalevelevan?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: qivu ti kina, panema ta uri uzazanga a vali aya.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: nu qazemezemetj neka zua kelebav i kalevelevan, tjevuta anga a vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: uri tjumaq anga amen uta.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: tjumatjumaq amen i djalan, kisaljinga aken ta vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: saljinga ken tua inika mangtjez a vali, pasa vaivaik anan aken a kivangavang aya ken.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: i ljaqediqedi tua nia umaq a ku gakku, djemedje aken a djemavac a sema gakku, sa 'u djavac uta a tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: inika tjaljiqacaqaca a nia gakku, inika tjuruvu a mareka vencik, namakakeljakeljang amen a masantalj.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: namatevetevelj amen i vava'asan, maciyuciyur amen a seman mali, sa'a matjatjauci'eci'el amen uta.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: kisaseljang tjanuamen a nia sinsi a kivangavang uta, namaya tua tacemekeljan amen i gakku.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: ljemita tu qadav a semuasuap amen, maljiyan tua namaparimasudj aravac a nia kakituluan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: izua vaik a semisic tua qezung, izua vaik a semuap ta zaqetja.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: nia suapen anan a penalinguljan a nia gakku, mapangapangalj amen tua sengsengan, namapalimasudj a ljemita tu qadav a nia gakku.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: navaik aken a sema qinaljan a kivala tjaivuvu tatiav.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: cuacuay anga men a inika mecevucevung, sengelit anga aken tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: tapacunan aken ni vuvu, pakanan aken tua suika, patekelan aken tua utja.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: qaljemaqem aravac a sinitalem ni vuvu a suika, sanguaq angata.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken a temekel tua utja ni vuvu uta, sanguaq aravac.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: vecekadan nu qadav, kemesa amen kati vuvu tua nia cengelj.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: nakemesa anga ti vuvu tua masanliyaliav a kinsa, izua ciqav, izua kuka, izua tjingkuy, izua kacikacing/dingding.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: ta makakincengelj amen, vaik amen a sema puljacengan a ki ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: sikalap aken ni vuvu tua liav a vurati, a vasa katua niniku, kacu-u a tjumaq aya.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶為我拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: ku kipusauan tiamadju, sa kinamangtjez anan nu tjaivililj a kivala tjanumun ku ayain.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: tucu a qadav kacuin amen ni sinsi a sema tua zaziljavan tua qemuziquzip, kipacumali amen a veneli tua kipu i paljing.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ta tedep amen i puqemuziquzipan, qivu ti sinsi, “aicu a i qayav mareka qayaqayam, azua i vililj mareka qatjuvi, ziljavu a masantalj.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: marekutj aken ta qatjuvi, manasika inika navaik a pacun tua mareka qatjuvi.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: pacun aken tua liav a qayaqayam, minlayalayap i vavav tua kasiv, izua za ljequ i taladje tua kasiv a nataqed uta.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: izua za zu, unma katua likuljav i puqemuziquzipan, inika napavala pacun tuca mareka qemuziquzip, maleva aken angata tua ku pinacunan tucu a qadav.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: napasasing aken a pakaliav, sa ku sipapacun tjai kama kati kina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: sa'a nu tjaivililj tjara kinakiciyur tjai kama kati kina a sema maza.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: tucu a pulavay, vaik a ken katua ku kaka a tjavulung a vavayan a sema akav a kivala tjai kama i Druna.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去屏東拜訪叔叔Druna。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: maka kisiya amen a kemasi Taihuku a sema Akav.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去屏東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: djemaljum amen i Akav, na unting tua haiya ti kama i Druna a kicacevung tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: 到了屏東，叔叔Druna開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: inika cemadja a umaq ni kama i Druna tua tisaba, inika cuway i djalan djemaljun anga.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔Druna家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: izua za i djemet tua umaq a tjaljiqacaqaca a quma ni kama i Druna, vaik amen a semazua a makapalidring.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔Druna家附近有個很大的牧場田園，我們一起騎腳踏車到田園。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: i tua quma, kacuin amen ni kama i Druna a pakan tua sizi katua gung.
S.TRANSL: 在田園裡，叔叔Druna帶我們餵羊和餵牛。
In the ranch, my uncle Druna took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: ta masulem, kacuin amen a sema lizuk a keman tua kinsa.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: liav aravac a pacacikecikel a sidusiya/haiya i kadjalanan, manasika maka utubai amen a sema zua.
S.TRANSL: 市區路上汔車來往很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: ta uri vavaik anga men izua, manu cinekav anga nia utubay, saka nia maka basu anga sakamay.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: nacemikel anga men a sema Taihuku tucu, inika ken a kemeljang tui djinumak anga a utubay ni kama i Druna.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔Druna的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: i Akav a nia umaq ta kakedriyan anan aken, ta sema gakku anga ken, patjavat amen a sema Tauyun, saka izuazua angamen i lizuk a kikavaljut a patjetucu.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在屏東，上學以後，就搬到了桃園，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Donghe. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: makalap anga aken tua taigakku, sa ku kitulu tuazuz masanitalj a patjara nu kacalisian a kakudakudan a tulu, avanazua kemeljang aken tua napenakaizuazua a tja kakudan a kacalisian i Taiwan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: manasika, tucu a cavilj a pulavay tua zulezulan, vaik aken katua ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay a sema qinaljan a kivadaq tua ramaljemaljeng, pasa kikeljang amen tua nitjen a kakudakudan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: aluangapuluq a cavilj ni vuvu, ljakua nu tja pacunan nasa'edriyan anan sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: ku kivadaqan timadju tu anemanema kinacaqu a kai, tauliq aravac a qivu tua penayuanan, macaqu a dremipungan, a dremekaiyan katua penairangan uta.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的排灣語說得很流利，也會說日本話、魯凱語和閩南語。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Saisiyat, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: ta makakivadaq anga ken tjaimadju, djaljepan ta kakedrian anan timadju, na kitulu tua dremipungan, azua cekelj se drekai zuku, saka pizua tua sengsengan nimadju nasekeljang tua tjuruvu a pairang, manasika liav a kinacaqu a kai nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是鲁凱族人，而他工作上認識許多漢人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: itua nia kinaqepuan, liav aravac a sitjaucikecikel tua patjara semicuacuayan a caquan nua qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ljai inika men a sepualalang, ljakua nia linuing a paka tua dingwa, maqati a nia umaljen anan a kiladenga.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: ta kakedrian anan aken, inika ken a nakemeljang tua tja kakudan a paiwan, nasemiaq tu kacalisian aken pai.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: nu tjaliav a ku kinljangan, tja ljemaui tu Paiwan zuku aken, napakisumalji, sedjaljep tu ku sikipasukuda uta.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為排灣族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Saisiyat is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: tucu a masulesulem a qadav, uri tjumaq a ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: vaik aken katua ku vuvu a sema siyubai a veneli ta kuka, padjulu ta sipakaiv tua ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: cemalivat amen itua paveliveli ta ljaceng, liav aravac a za namapakaizuazua a nasasanguaq a ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: naveneli amen tua kabula, qaqilj katua taicav.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了白菜、山藥和蘿蔔。
We bought chinese cabbage, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: maitucu aza paveliveli ta kudamunu a tauki, “qaljemaqem aravac ca u pangudralj katua kutjis. pay veliyu tu kedri!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: saka nia veli anga ta pangudralj katua kutjis.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: cemalivat amen tua puvutjuljan, qivu a tauki, “anema nu veliin? pacuni cu a u kuka kakudralan saka sasanguaq aravac, nu ita tjeluaiday a avelian.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?請看我賣的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: pazangal cu aya ti vuvu, saka kivadaq ta tauki tui maqati a papemadjuluin.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: ljakua qivu a tauki, madjulu anga cu, inika maqati anga tja kiluvadan aya.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: maitucu aza kiljaqediqedi a tauki a qivu, idu veliyu ta ku ciqav, kakudralan sa mamadjuluan.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: ta vililjanga naveneli anga men ta kuka ta ciqaw, saka nia vaik anga a tjumaq a kemesa tua tahandayan a djamay.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: cuai amen a kiljaljavaljav, masulem anga.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: manu pakadinguwa a ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay, inika maqati anga a pulavai aya i pusivitayan, uri pinutjaivililj anga ku sisatjumaqan aya.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: na kemesa anga itjen a pakaliav aya ti vuvu, pai tja kanavanga sakamaya a masantalj!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: nia djauljen anga sakamaya a nia kaka katua nia qali, saka nia atevetevelj a kaiv.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: izua za ku salasaladj a ti Uljelje, ru draudrav a kemacu tua nemanga nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Uljelje，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Uljelje, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: nu kitulutulu amen, kisedjam timadju tua salasaladj ta inpic, siquliqulip katua vaveikan a laqulj/zakitju.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: puita, pudrusa, putjelu, nia pasedjam sakamaya timadja.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ljakua, izua za nakuyakuya a sikudakudan nimadju, inika ru pacikel tua kinisedjam a nemanga.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: ta vililjanga, nekanga nu salasaladj a pasapasedjam tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: izua tu ita qadav, vaik amen a maciyuciyur a kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: ta i djalan amen, manu malingav ti Uljelje, ljakua inika napaqenetj a kemacu tua siidjuadjuas.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Uljelje想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Uljelje wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: saka patjanemain a salasaladj tua sikidjuadjuas, tevelain a mayatucu, inika men a nakemacu uta ayain.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: qemaung anga ti Uljelje tua uwalan. madudu a qivu, awa inika mun a pasedjam tjanuaken tua sikidjuadjuas aya!
S.TRANSL: Uljelje急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Uljelje burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: qaqivuin nua salasaladj a mayatucu, ayatua inika sun a nakemacu, saka nu tja pasedjaman sun ta nemanga, inika sun a pacikecikel uta!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: ta maljiya, namedjama anga ti Uljelje i gakku, saka pacikeli a kinisedjam a nemanga tua mareka salasaladj a penuljat.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Uljelje很早就到學校了，Uljelje把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Uljelje arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: pudjavadjavai tua mareka salasaladj ti Uljelje, saka qivu a mayatucu, kiken a kemacu anga tua ku nemanga nutjaivililj, saka pumaljimalji tua mareka salasaladj tua pinasedjaman tjaimadju a pasusangas anga a qadav.
S.TRANSL: Uljelje向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Uljelje apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: cinunan a 'u ama i qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: ta kakedriyan anan aken, nu qazemezemetj vaik a casav ti kama kati kama i Kapi, nakemacu tua tjakit katua kuang.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔Kapi會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle Kapi would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: nu maljia, nakemacu anga tua qinaljup a sacemal tiamadju.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: nucuayanga vavui, nucuayanga lava, panema tua padjavatan uta.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: pangapangaljen a sacemel i sipangetjez i qinaljan niamadju, sa'a qaluti a sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: ku culaqen ti kama, vaik aken a keciyur tjanusun a qemaljup ku ayain.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: ulja sun a meqaca anan, ku kacuav anga ayain aken ni kama/ama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: pudringai a mareka uqaljaqaljay i qinaljan tua sacemel uta, macaqu tiamadj a semanaya tua seluc katua caqeljip/qezetj.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: macaqu aravac ti ama a seman seluc, sidringadringay cu tua padjavatan aya ti ama, nia puqezeljan a djukap na sacemel, sa nia pudringai a pinakazuazuanan a djaladjalan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: aza saljinga ken a kiciyur ta ramaljeng a qemalju, djemedje aken a kicaquan tua seman dringay, manu inika cuacuay dremingai a paruarut a ku sinanaya a dringan tua sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: pacun ti ama tua ku sipudringayan, qivu a mayatucu, maljiyan tua uri lemanav sun a cinunan aya.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: tucu a meqaca anga ken, ku sevaljen a ku vetjeljatan katua panaq, sa'a vaik a kiciyur tjai ama a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: cemikel amen a sema qinaljan, nia siqalut a nia inalap a sacemel tua nia sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: qivu ti ama, maleva itjen tua papuluqem nua tja vuvu, pinapusepiyan itjen tucu a qadav.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: na sekavililj aken a sema gakku ta kadjaman.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: inika na kemacu aken tua kabang, ta vaik aken a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: neka nu ku kinacu a nanemaneman.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: nu kitulutulu amen, pacun amen a meseljang ta laqulj katua ku salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: nu siking amen, pasedjaman aken ta inpic katua siquliqulip na ku salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: qivu ti sinsi tjanuaken a mayatucu, “djamau anga paceged nu tjaivililj mayanga sekavililj!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: ti Puljaljuyan a ku qali, aljak nua paiwan zuku auta timadju.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫 Puljaljuyan，他也是排灣族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Puljaljuyan, and he is also an Paiwan child.

S.FORM: kitulutulu amen i Tjaljakavus a mamav.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在來義部落讀書。
We study together in the Tjaljakavus tribe.

S.FORM: ru vaik amen a kilangeda ta ramaljemaljeng a menilimilingan, macaqu amen aravac a penaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說排灣語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.

S.FORM: qacaqaca sa kudrakudral aken, kedrikedri sa kuljakuljay ti Puljaljuyan.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Puljaljuyan很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Puljaljuyan is short and thin.

S.FORM: na rucikal aravac ti Puljaljuyan,kinatjengelayan timadju nua timaimanga.
S.TRANSL: Puljaljuyan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Puljaljuyan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: undukay tucu a qadav nua gakku,liyav a malalumalj a pinadjulu nua gakku.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: izua maqaqesir, djemakadjak ta mali, mekelj, iyuki katua penanaq.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: ilalumaljan aken tua mekelj.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: ta mekekelj a ken, sequlilj aken, pedjamuq tu qaca a ku cungal.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ljakua migacalj aken sa na mekelj sakamaya a patjaiqayav.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: maleva tjuruvu a caucau ta tjeljavang aken sa djaljun tua qaqacuvungan.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ini na sangasangasan ljakua namaleva ken aravac ayatua naqemacuvung aken tua malalumalj.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: na vaik amen tatiav kati kama a paljilji tjai kama i Kapi.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪kapi叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: nasekakuda a kula ni kama i kapi.
S.TRANSL: Kapi叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: namaperunganga a qinaljivan aya timadju a pasemalav tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: na matjani timadju a kemasi qaljiv ta seman nanguanguaq tua qaljiv.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: na kemacu ti kama ta vutjulj na kung katua saviki tu sipavay tja kama i Kapi.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給Kapi叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: liav a siniqivu ni kama i Kapi a milimilingan ta maljavaljavar amen i qarengan.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: nameqaca sa namesauqaljayanga sun aya ti kama i Kapi a semanzua tjanuaken ta uri vaik anga ken.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: pangtjezuanga kivala a sema tjanuamen nu navenalanga su kula ku ayain ti kama i Kapi.
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: ta 2022 a cavilj napakaigi a sihu ta maqatianga sepapuvecik a tja ngadan a kinacalisian a pitua tja mibunsiu.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: nakisusu aken tua kisamuljamulja a kiqaunga tua sihu ta sepapuvecik a tja ngadan a kinacalisian a pitua tja mibunsiu a tja maqacuvucuvung i qinaljan a ti Puljaljuan.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Puljaljuyan。
I interviewed Puljaljuyan, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: na mare kicun anga men ta nu tucu a pulavalavay vaik amen a sema ta umaq nimadju a maljavaljavar
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ta maljavaljavar amen pasemalavan aken ta kinasizuanan nua ngadan nimadju, sa na pakeljangi tua sikatacemekeljan nimadju katua qinaljan nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他告訴我他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: ku kivadaqan timadju tu anema sikipatjemacay ta pavalit tua ngadan,a inika nanguaq a kakudan a sikipuvecikan a pasusangas?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: qivu timadju tjanuaken a mayatucu, “ayatua a tjiniukukuan inika maqati a mapasalusu a siqivuan tua ngadan nimadju, tjuruvu a caucau a ti Pu sinseng aya tjaimadju, sa napenepedjeli aravac.”
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Pu Xian Sheng

S.FORM: qivu ti Puljaljuyan, “a tja ngadan a vincikan tua tjavecik avanazua tja kangadanan,a ku ngadan sinipupatarevan ta ku qinaljan ku kinacemekeljan ta ku nasi,ulja napatja tjuruvu a caucau a pacikel tua tjaratja ngadangadan.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Puljaljuyan said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: na vaik amen a semiyubay ta tiav a ti vuvu i vavayan,liav a kinacu ni vuvu a sinitalem nimadju a ljaceng,sa na seman kakanen ta nu kacalisian auta a sipavay ta timaimanga.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: tjuruvu a tjengelay ta siyubay ni vuvu i vavayan, tjuruvu a veneli ta silji katua vurati, tjuruvu auta a qemayam tua sinandjamay nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和地瓜很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and sweet potato, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: maljiyan tu sanguaq a kinesa nimadju a lukuc katua djuadjuya a paday, izua nan a cinapan a vutjulj na vavuy, tjuruvu a namadjaulja ta saluman, sa nacumali, a timaimanga izua ta nia siubay.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉烤的肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: ta kemesakesa ti vuvu i vavayan, izua ken a tjemautjautjav i ljaqediqedi a idu veliu ta nia sinitalem a tiamen a ljaceng, inika pinabusbusan ta cemel.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, “The vegetables are self-grown, all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!”

S.FORM: veliyen a pakirimurimu a nia nemanga,qivu ti vuvu a mayatucu ayatua izua sun a napusaladj a paveli aya,
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”

S.FORM: pakasimaza, kituluanga ken ta caquan na patjara tataleman katua kakanen na kacalisian, sa nakemeljang auta ta zelian na semiyubaubay.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
